Progress will discontinue Telerik Platform on May 10th, 2018. Learn more

deploy android

Usage Synopsis
General $ appbuilder deploy android [--device <Device ID>] [--certificate <Certificate ID>] [--debug] [--release]

Builds the project for Android and deploys it to connected physical devices. If --device is not specified, deploys the project on all connected physical devices and running Android virtual devices.

You can choose which files from your project to exclude or include in your application package by maintaining an .abignore file. For more information about .abignore, see abignore.md.

Options

  • --debug - If set, applies the Debug build configuration. For more information about build configurations, see build configurations.
  • --release - If set, applies the Release build configuration. For more information about build configurations, see build configurations.
  • --device - Specifies the serial number or the index of the connected device on which you want to deploy the app. To list all connected devices, grouped by platform, run $ appbuilder device
  • --certificate - Sets the certificate that you want to use for code signing your Android app. You can set a certificate by index or name. To list available certificates, run $ appbuilder certificate

Attributes

  • <Device ID> is the device index or identifier as listed by $ appbuilder device
  • <Certificate ID> is the index or name of the certificate as listed by $ appbuilder certificate

Related Commands

Command Description
build Builds the project for the target platform and produces an application package or a QR code for deployment.
build android Builds the project for Android platform and produces an application package or a QR code for deployment.
build ios Builds the project for iOS platform and produces an application package or a QR code for deployment.
build wp8 Builds the project for Windows Phone 8 platform and produces an application package or a QR code for deployment.
debug Shows the debug tools to let you debug applications on connected devices.
debug ios Lets you debug applications on connected iOS devices.
debug android Lets you debug applications on connected Android devices.
deploy Builds the project for the selected platform and deploys it to connected physical devices.
deploy ios Builds the project for ios platform and deploys it to connected physical devices.
emulate Builds the specified project in the cloud and runs it in a native emulator.
emulate android Builds the specified project in the cloud and runs it in a native Android emulator.
emulate ios Builds the specified project in the cloud and runs it in the native iOS Simulator.
emulate wp8 Builds the specified project in the cloud and runs it in the native emulator from the Windows Phone 8.
livesync Synchronizes the latest changes in your project to connected devices.
livesync android Synchronizes the latest changes in your project to connected Android devices.
livesync ios Synchronizes the latest changes in your project to connected iOS devices.
livesync cloud Synchronizes the project with the cloud to enable LiveSync via wireless connection.
remote Starts a remote server to let you run your app in the iOS Simulator from a Windows system.
simulate Runs the current project in the device simulator.
